definition: with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: The cooperation among China, Japan and ROK complies with the trend of times and therefore has a bright prospect.
sentences.chinese: 中日韩合作顺应时代潮流，大有可为。

sentences.english: Practice has proved the dyeing on the real silk of natural plant dyestuffs has bright prospects.
sentences.chinese: 实践证明天然植物染料在真丝绸上的染色大有可为。

sentences.english: There is potential for selective breeding for better yields.
sentences.chinese: 选种培育以提高产量会大有可为。

sentences.english: Plant genetics is another field showing the promise of open innovation.
sentences.chinese: 植物遗传学是开放创意大有可为的另一个领域。

sentences.english: In view of this, we can foresee a bright future for geomancy in America.
sentences.chinese: 有鉴于此，我们可以预见风水在美国将大有可为。

sentences.english: There are bright prospects for freshwater fish farming.
Due to their speciality, the literary and artistic activities play a very important role in the work of therapy.
sentences.chinese: 文艺活动的特殊性质，使其在矫治工作中大有可为。

definition: to accomplish much/to have good prospects/to have a promising future
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to have a promising future/to have bright prospects
general trend/irresistible trend
to come at the right time/to be opportune
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
opportunity/favorable circumstance/stroke of luck
to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising
vigorous expansion/rapid development
sunrise industry
circumstances require action (idiom); absolutely necessary/imperative
development/growth/to develop/to grow/to expand
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
industry/estate/property/industrial
to collapse (of plan, talks etc)
imminent/just around the corner (idiom)
